Comment.value:
if the wife has not been saved

CHARISMA NORMAL

value.0: The roads in this area are home to creatures of all sorts... ogres, bandits, hobgoblins and the like. Normally they don't trouble us much. Since our local guards stopped patrolling the area, mind you, they've become plenty brave.
For weeks, now, they've been attacking anyone passing through these parts. Attacked the town a few times, too... that's when the hobgoblins made off with my wife.

I would gladly head to the Neverwinter if it wasn't for the Wailing Death and the dangerous road. I won't leave without my wife, Leah, however... or at least until I know for sure what happened to her.
Leah is her name. She was taken from the farm one evening when the boy and I were out collecting supplies. Nothing we could have done about it.
Them creatures have never shown any interest in taking folk before... I'm not even sure why they should start now. I can only pray that she's all right, yet. I'll get her back, somehow...
I'd be grateful for it. Find my wife or bring me proof of what's happened to her... It would be a great service to a retired adventurer.
I... I certainly hope so, <lad/lass>. It all depends on what these monsters do with their prisoners. I've braced myself for the worst, to be honest.
There's a few of them spread out north of town. However... be sure you don't get lost.
There's one entrance in the hills just north of here, most likely somewhere in the High Road, though I can't say where exactly.
To be honest, I haven't much left from my adventuring days. I'd be happy to offer something magical, though, to have some proof of what happened to my wife... or, better yet, to have her returned.

Comment.value: Player is aware of the plot, but has not yet saved Leah or been rewarded for saving her

value.0: Thank you, <lad/lass>, for bringing me a bit of peace of mind. I hope this armor from my adventuring days will suffice for the trouble you've taken.

Things are just about right, I guess... but not quite. The area is still unsafe so long as the monsters are still about. Perhaps if someone could go kill their leader, it could pacify them, at least for a while.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I may be old, but I still have my wit. I insist that you bring me proof. Kill the leader of the hobgoblins, and bring me his head.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> You what? That is spectacular... Now I can rest easy, for the time being. Here, take this gold as payment for your deed. And thank you.
Thank you. Please return to me when you have slain their leader.

Comment.value: Leah dead, earring returned, Dergiab's head NOT returned

LinkComment.value: Either the head or Leah quest incomplete

value.0: Thank you again for your help. You give this old man solace, for the time being. I am sure that another will come to take his place in the near future, though. Come see me again, as I have some more gold saved up for another undertaking.

Comment.value: Dergiab plot finished, Leah is dead
Either the head or Leah quest incomplete
Player has Leah's earring, have not yet returned it, normal IQ

value.0: I have Leah's ring right here. I'm sorry, but she's dead.
It will do.
Farewell.
<StartCheck>[Bluff]</Start> Speaking of which, I've already slain their leader.
I could look into that.
I could look into killing the hobgoblin's leader.
The hobgoblin's leader is dead. Here, I have his head.
That is fine.
Farewell.
